definition.name: Get Current Pull Request
definition.description: Get the PR associated with the current commit.
definition.author: 8BitJonny

inputs.name: github-token
inputs.description: The GitHub token used to create an authenticated client.

inputs.name: sha
inputs.description: Sha to get PR for. Defaults to current sha.

inputs.name: filterOutClosed
inputs.description: True, False, 1 or 0 if only open PRs should be returned. Defaults to false.

inputs.name: filterOutDraft
inputs.description: True, False, 1 or 0 if only non-draft PRs should be returned. Defaults to false.

outputs.name: pr_found
outputs.description: The outcome if a PR has been found. If so, the other outputs are set.

outputs.name: pr
outputs.description: The whole PR object if one was found.

outputs.name: number
outputs.description: The PR number if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_title
outputs.description: The PR Title if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_body
outputs.description: The PR Body if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_url
outputs.description: The PR Url if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_created_at
outputs.description: The PR Created timestamp if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_merged_at
outputs.description: The PR Merged timestamp if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_closed_at
outputs.description: The PR Closed timestamp if one was found.

outputs.name: pr_labels
outputs.description: The PR Labels if any was found.

evidence.reasoning: This action retrieves information about the current pull request, which is essential for communication and collaboration in a development workflow. It also relates to code quality by providing context on pull requests that may affect the codebase.
